title: Data Engineer
descr: MORE ABOUT THIS JOB Consumer and Commercial Banking (CCBD) Consumer and Commercial Banking brings innovative solutions to traditional banking activities. We are a global team of lenders, investors, risk managers, skilled marketers, web experts and banking specialists. We provide a suite of solutions to help our customers meet their personal financial goals. We make direct investments in, and risk manage, a portfolio of corporate loans and securities. And we help transform distressed communities through investments and loans of private capital. Digital Finance Description Digital Finance, a business unit within CCBD, is comprised of the firm’s digitally-led consumer businesses, which include the Marcus deposits and lending businesses, as well as the personal financial management app, Clarity Money. Digital Finance combines the strength and heritage of a 148-year-old financial institution with the agility and entrepreneurial spirit of a tech start-up. Through the use of machine learning and intuitive design, we provide customers with powerful tools that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity to help them make smarter decisions about their money. Your Impact Clarity Money is a business recently acquired by Goldman Sachs that offers a revolutionary AI- and machine learning-based product for consumers to improve their financial health. Ushering in a new era of mobile personal finance management apps, Clarity Money uses artificial intelligence and data science to help consumers make smarter financial decisions and get the most from their money. The revolutionary features allow users to cancel bills, get a better credit card and create a savings account, all from within the app, and all at the push of a button. The Clarity Money team is actively seeking a motivated Data Engineer with proven industry experience in machine learning, data engineering and building robust data pipelines. Strong computer science fundamentals are key to success in this role. The ideal candidate should be an individual contributor, a positive team player and willing to get things done. RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS Required Qualifications:   5+ years of relevant industry experience. Solid engineering and programming skills. Ability to write high performance production quality code with Python and/or Scala. Experience building efficient large-scale data pipelines and data warehousing solutions. Strong SQL and NoSQL skills. Knowledge about Docker, CircleCI, Jenkins, testing, version control systems is required. Proficiency in building data pipeline from scratch and deploying them on cloud environment (AWS or similar). Proven experience in processing large sets of data in batch and real time fashion using Hadoop, MapR, Spark, Kafka, Kinesis etc. Ability to engage with other teams to design the optimal data architecture for a new scale platform and infrastructure to support data and analytics-based product innovation. Preferred Qualifications:   Proficiency in probability, statistics, feature engineering and exploratory data analysis and extracting insights using Python, R or similar tools. Eager to get your hands dirty. Experience with consumer products/services (including but not limited to: consumer lending, mobile banking applications, deposits etc.). Experience with deploying, maintaining and iterating over large-scale machine learning systems to drive improvement of current products and the development of novel features and products within the company’s vision. Experience with data visualization libraries like seaborn, D3Js or tools like Tableau. Self-starter and curious. ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2018. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

title: Point72 Quantitative Researcher
descr: Point72 Quantitative Researcher   Experience Experienced Professionals   Location New York | Stamford   Area Systematic Investing   Business Point72    Job Description Point72 Asset Management is looking for a Quantitative Researcher or Senior Quantitative Researcher to contribute to its core business and to develop new areas of expertise. The candidate should possess outstanding empirical research skills, expert-level knowledge of statistical techniques, and competence in programming. The candidate is responsible for conducting quantitative finance research with a focus on alpha extraction from high volume and/or non-structured datasets. Handle all aspects of the research process including methodology selection, data collection and analysis, testing, prototyping, implementation, backtesting, and performance monitoring. Job Responsibilities · Be a  member of the research team  and help drive and deliver on the team’s growing research agenda. · Alpha idea generation, backtesting and implementation · Improvement of existing strategies and portfolio optimization · Evaluating new datasets for alpha potential · Participation in maintenance and improvement of production and trading environment Desirable Candidates · MS, PhD or PhD candidates in mathematics, statistics, quantitative finance, physics, computer science, or other quantitative discipline. · Academic and/or professional experiences in advanced machine learning and data mining strongly preferred. · For Senior Quantitative Researcher only: Minimum of 3 years of work experience as a quantitative researcher in a mid-frequency or high-frequency team (holding period below 1 month) trading equities, with hands on experience developing, researching or implementing quantitative equities models. Senior Quant Researcher candidate must have 5 years or more of experience. Fresh graduates will be considered for the junior quant researcher position; prior internship experience in this industry strongly preferred. · Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research utilizing large data sets, including, but not limited to, intraday tick data. · Hands on experiences applying advanced machine learning methods to quantitative equities research highly preferred. · Experience with natural language processing techniques a plus. · Possesses good intuition for conducting empirical financial research and strong analytical, econometrics and quantitative skills. · Experience in intraday alpha signal research a strong plus. · Experience with large-scale portfolio optimization and multi-period optimization a strong plus. · Must have strong programming skills in multiple languages such as Python, SQL, Matlab, Java,, C++, and R. · Detail-oriented · Highly motivated, willing to take ownership of his/her work. · Thrive working both independently and collaboratively within a small team. · Effective communicator of research ideas and willing to proactively engage other team members in fostering a strong collaborative team-oriented research environment.   Point72 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Point72 is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. Point72 complies with applicable, local, state and federal laws on the subject of equal employment opportunity.

title: Data Engineer Specialist - Healthcare Analytics, New Ventures
descr: You will code and test tools and assets to deliver analytics to our customers which will be defined by high quality. You will collaborate with the product and delivery team on the definition and requirements of an analytics product within an agile framework. Additionally, you'll perform the transformation, filtering, and aggregation of raw data into concise, accurate, and focused data marts. You'll be an integral part of our team with ample opportunities for coaching and mentorship from your senior colleagues.

title: Data Analyst
descr: About the Company: PlaceIQ is a powerful, location-based audience and insights platform that organizes a wide variety of consumer activity data around a precise location base map at massive scale. PlaceIQ uses its detailed understanding of location and consumer activity to reach a targeted audience, and also to derive powerful insights about consumer behavior to inform market and business strategies for national brands. The company is headquartered in New York City and has offices in San Jose and Chicago. The Role: As a Data Analyst at PlaceIQ, you will define, interpret and evaluate PlaceIQ Audience products and the data that powers them. The ideal candidate will apply a unique blend of analytical and creative skills to develop hypotheses, solve problems and contribute to the growth and composition of PlaceIQ’s suite of audience products. A Data Analyst will leverage requirements from different business inputs to analyze and deliver new audiences, as well as identify opportunities to improve existing ones. Key Responsibilities: Analyze different types of data geospatially to derive insights about relationships between locations, statistical measurements and qualitatively assess the data Create audiences with ranging complexities and a variety of defining data types using our custom suite of tools Conduct detailed audience analysis, perform database queries and reviews of test results to validate, identify issues and formulate remediation plans for improvement Identify and align opportunities for improvement with business cases and data quality goals Coordinate with cartography analysts to evaluate and scope data for new audience requests Generate and communicate reports on audiences and other findings in different formats Participate in data management and audience initiatives involving multiple customers and provide subject matter expertise Requirements: Experience with SQL as well as scripting languages such as Python for manipulating data preferred Experience with location-based or geospatial data preferred Experience with data analysis balancing the creative and the pragmatic Experience in market research, working with consumer analytics, insights and use cases preferred Knowledge of demographics, market segmentation and/or a background in cultural anthropology Business solution development – ability to ramp up quickly on marketing / audience domain Highly effective written and verbal skills, experience generating and presenting content. Technical writing a bonus Experience working in an Agile environment a bonus

title: Quantitative Researcher
descr: AXA is a leading financial protection company, committed to fostering and maintaining a diverse, multicultural and inclusive environment, and one of the nation's premier providers of life insurance and annuity products. The organization was established in 1859 and we are committed now more than ever to helping clients meet financial goals in all stages of their lives. One of the hallmarks of our proud heritage is providing world-class customer service. We're always looking for smart and talented people to help us develop new and innovative ways to expand our product portfolio, reach new customers and serve well the clients already a part of the AXA family. Job Purpose AXA is seeking a creative, highly motivated and detail-oriented quantitative researcher with a strong background in financial engineering to join our team. In this role, you will support the development of hedging strategy for the Variable Annuity business, apply quantitative techniques to large and unconventional datasets and purse unexplored research topics related to our statutory risk profile. The Quantitative Researcher will be engaged in an exciting effort to design and implement state-of-the-art quantitative models that drive our Variable Annuity Hedging program. Responsibilities include:  Developing hedging strategies, from idea generation and data collection to analysis and model creation.  Advancing existing initiatives to pursue unexplored research topics to our statutory risk profile and nested stochastic calculation to assess Hedge Credit.  Be part of a broader team to support the daily and statutory hedging, collaborate with team members to design and develop reliable hedging pipelines that produce high quality results.  Developing tools and platform enhancements to bolster productivity through innovative system-building and automation.  Proactively analyzing P&L attribution, running stress scenarios as well as performance measurement adjustments, forecasting P&L attribution and pursuing wide-ranging research to improve attribution performance. Qualifications  Master's degree in; financial mathematics, engineering, physics, statistics, actuarial (or a related quantitative or technical discipline). A post-graduate degree indicating strong quantitative and technical ability is a plus  2+ years relevant experience ideally within Hedging, Variable Annuity, Quantitative Risk Management, (Path-dependent) Derivative Pricing, Scenario Generation, Quantitative Research or related function.  Adept coding experience utilizing at least one of the following: C++, Matlab, Python, Perl. VBA is a prerequisite.  Solid analytical and organizational skills, ability to communicate complex ideas and great attention to detail.  Demonstration of high intellectual capacity and curiosity; Strong work ethic (takes ownership), self-starter and quick-study mentality; ability to work independently yet also lead and inspire large cross-functional team (Actuarial Hedging).  Applicants selected will be evaluated on both their technical skills and their ability to demonstrate clear judgment, critical thinking, keen attention to detail and intellectual honesty. Other information NOTE: AXA participates in the E-Verify program. In addition to competitive compensation and an outstanding benefits package including 401 (k) and medical programs, we offer the opportunity for continued professional development in a congenial corporate environment. AXA is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to our employees, applicants and candidates based on individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, mental or physical disabilities, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information or any other class protected by federal, state and local laws. #LI-AXA1

title: Research Data Analyst
descr: Overview Hospital for Special Surgery Department of Anesthesiology Job Description - Research Data Analyst Reports to : Dr. Stavros Memtsoudis; Assistant Director, Research; Director, Research Responsibilities:   Assist in the publication of high quality research articles via data mining, manipulation, preparation and analysis of various internal and external databases Use patient data within the EPIC electronic medical record to conduct internal research projects and format data for contribution to external multidisciplinary database collaborations Manage statistical and methodological projects within the research division Prepare materials for scientific documents. Conduct data analysis and prepare statistical graphs and tables for research presentations, abstracts, manuscripts and grants. Participate in research leadership initiatives and committees, and proactively suggest improvements Assist in the educational activities of fellows and residents Maintain and enhance professional skills and growth through participation in meetings, seminars, professional affiliations, and internal training sessions to keep abreast of trends in the field of research data management Department Requirements:   Displays a positive attitude toward work assignments, performance feedback, and interactions with co-workers, patients, families, and visitors Willingly adheres to Department and Hospital policies and procedures Maintains computer literacy, including proficiency in Outlook email and E-learning Attends Department meetings regularly and punctually Qualifications:   Bachelors degree in statistics, biostatistics or related field required. Masters degree preferred. Prior research experience preferred Proficiency in Microsoft Office and statistical software Ability to interpret medical data and generate sound recommendations to support clinical research efforts Excellent oral and written communications skills

title: Data Analyst
descr: Responsibilities Devise KPIs for business segments with key stakeholders and help build the infrastructure and reporting / dashboards Liaise the Sales Operations team with the Data and Engineering team to fulfill data infrastructure that needs to be built for the self-reporting tool Utilize historical data and secondary research to provide insights to inform business decisions Improve current business processes through identifying opportunities for improvements and automation Partner with key stakeholders such as Regional Marketing, Integrated Marketing, Enterprise and Regional Sales to optimize the sales funnel by running data-driven test Assist team members with crafting stories based on data Support management and team members with gathering insights for ad hoc requests Ability to work well in a lean team Qualifications 3+ years functional experience required, preferably in a technical role. Expertise in one or more BI and data visualization tools (Chartio, Tableau, Looker). Exceptional SQL skills. Analysis, statistics, and visualization is a plus. Experience with running A/B tests is a plus Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to collaborate with data and software engineers as well as non-t environmen Passion for data and its fundamental ability to create value Flexibility with working on changing work schedules with the ability to work independently and solve problems on your own. Strong work ethic, intellectual curiosity, good judgment, mature and positive attitude.

title: Marketing Analytics Manager
descr: ConsenSys is a venture production studio and  the leading technology firm in blockchain globally . We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers. Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us. About the role: ConsenSys is seeking a analytics and insights specialist to lead the marketing team in using data to inform the creation, execution, and measure performance of growth strategies across campaigns and channels from Google Search to various social media platforms. The role will focus on setting up and analyzing the performance of our key channels including but not limited to, Google AdWords, SEO, paid and organic social, and email. This will include everything from analyzing results (weekly, monthly, by campaign), performing deep-dive analysis on each of the channels, providing insights into the overall campaign contribution and delivery to the marketing objectives/goals, designing pilot tests, measuring the performance, assisting in campaign optimizations, as well as identifying key business opportunities. The person in this role will be responsible for setting up reporting and dashboards from scratch, and will be responsible for an audit of historic performance by channel to develop a benchmark for future success. Previous experience with startups and/or agencies are a plus, especially in the capacity of setting up new analytics and tracking systems for new companies. The person in this role will help define not only how ConsenSys gathers and interprets data about the performance of its own channels and marketing campaigns, but will also help the portfolio companies we are developing in our venture production studio model to launch their own analytics programs. Responsibilities: Weekly analysis of performance marketing channel spend and performance across all key metrics Building data templates to enable ongoing reporting of analysis and tracking of performance Collaborate with the Marketing team to design, implement and monitor optimization tests within each channel Establish KPI goals and benchmarks for each individual channel Identify optimization opportunities and perform sizing analysis to assess the incremental audience, revenue, contribution margin and other potential impacts to our KPIs Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with different stakeholders across all levels of ConsenSys Work closely with strategy and business development teams to identify critical business questions and potential areas of opportunity and translate these questions into technical requirements Transform collected data into analyses and presentable insights and recommendations for action by creating dashboards, reports, and analyses that explain the customer digital experience/journey data based storytelling Identify, manage and maintain, troubleshoot tracking and conversion defects Requirements: 4+ years analytics experience in Paid Search and other digital marketing channels (AdWords, paid social, app marketing, etc.) Experience in web analytics requirements gathering, solution design and implementation Experience setting up and managing Google Analytics from scratch. Other analytics experience could include MixPanel and KissMetrics. Experience tracking the performance of a mobile application launch in the Apple and Android App Store. Experience tracking performance of our SEO, AdWords, paid and organic social, and email channels. Experience with visitor intelligence / behavior, tracking/tagging, and cohort analysis. Experience with various attribution models (last click, time decay, position based) Javascript development experience, pixel implementation experience a plus Working knowledge of SQL and relational databases a plus Strong analytical skills and database experience, including ability to perform detailed analysis and modelling in excel, ex. pivot tables, vlookup Strong ability to derive insights and recommendations from data and turn them into actionable marketing insights Willing to put in time and research to understand blockchain topics Happy to take the lead or collaborate closely with a team Excitement about how blockchain is going to change the world Strong communication and interpersonal skills Here are some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ConsenSys: The forefront of a revolution.  At ConsenSys we fundamentally believe that a next generation of technologies presents the opportunity to create a more just and equitable society. A dynamic startup environment.  ConsenSys is a thought leader in the blockchain space and we are absorbing a significant portion of the mindshare. This is both exciting and challenging, as we learn to scale our organization while adhering to the principles of decentralization. Continuous learning.  Youll be constantly exposed to new languages, frameworks and ideas from your peers and as you work on different projects -- challenging you to stay at the top of your game. Deep technical challenges.  This entire ecosystem is about 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler. There is much work to be done before these platforms can scale to the order of millions or billions of users. ConsenSys is building the technology platforms that can get us to those next thresholds of scale. Click here for the latest updates from ConsenSys.

title: Data Analyst
descr: Job Description Responsibilities: Creating and Managing data quality documentation; Measuring data quality level of specific data sets and identify process improvement; Preparing, delivering reports and recommendations; Proposing approaches to address data quality issues; Performing analytical Assessment of Client Deliverables; Interpreting and analyzing data; Maintaining and managing database with a strong attention to detail as to ensure accuracy and completeness of the stored data; Summarizing information and present findings internally as requested; Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree/Master’s degree preferred; 5-7 years of related experience; Experience in business analysis, data analysis or related experience. Strong analytical skills, with the ability to prepare analyses using a variety of statistical, spreadsheet and database programs; Exceptional writing skills, with the ability to clearly and thoroughly present quantitative and qualitative review findings; Ability to write effectively; Excellent communication skills; Ability to work independently on projects as assigned with minimal supervision; Ability to handle all aspects in the full cycle of a research project; Ability to manage time effectively; Ability to relate to staff at all levels of familiarity with computers and statistics; Familiarity with Fluxx Grants Management Software a plus. Company Description The Conference on Jewish Material Claims against Germany, Inc. (Claims Conference), an international non-profit organization headquartered in New York, was established in 1951 to negotiate a program of indemnification for material damages to Jewish individuals and to the Jewish people caused by Germany through the Holocaust. This respected organization administers several major programs for the benefit of Holocaust survivors worldwide and actively negotiates with the German government. The Claims Conference is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of any category protected by law, including (without limitation) race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
descr: Summary: The primary function of this position is to provide data and analytical support for Emblem's Two-sided Shared Risk initiative and ACO development. Major responsibilities include working with senior Two-sided Shared Risk analysts, contract managers and ACO provider entities. Assess disease burden and utilization patterns for individual provider entities' and their managed populations. ACO reporting series will include standard ACO reports on provider clinical and care management performance. The analyst will respond to ad hoc requests with timely and actionable information to help Emblem achieve major milestones and goals for our Two-sided Shared Risk initiative. Accountabilities: Assist Two-sided Shared Risk program implementation. Identify eligible member population at each provider entity level by specific products and by individual IPOs. Develop baseline information on member population assessment and provider utilization patterns. Using hospital, medical, pharmacy claims, and data from other sources, help identify opportunities for targeted intervention and define the clinical performance measures. Under supervision will gather data from Emblem's data warehouse, Medstat, other systems and vendors, and will work to ensure integrity of the data from various sources. Create regular monthly ACO reporting package for each entity which will measure provider performance on the clinical and care management matrix as defined under Two-sided Shared Risk contract. Standardize and streamline the reporting process. Under guidance provide regular reports and feedback datasets to each ACO entities with timely and actionable information to facility their respective clinical intervention programs and member outreaches. Interact with senior analysts in responding to Two-sided Shared Risk contract managers to ad hoc data and analytical requests in support of the program and relationship management. Collaborate with Senior Analysts, Medical Directors and Care Management team. Will learn how to conduct evaluation studies, as needed, to assess clinical effectiveness and/or cost efficiency for specific intervention programs associated with the Two-sided Shared Risk initiative. Prepare documentation on reporting specification and analytical requirement to assure that the reports cre Qualifications: Skills&Knowledge: Strong analytical and logical skills paired with strong attention to detail Proactive and self-motivated, and ability to take initiative in designing and completing projects Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines Team Player, resourceful and strong facilitator Strong organizations skills and decision making ability Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills are needed to interact with all levels of staff, both internally and externally Extensive business understanding of the healthcare payor industry. Familiar with claims, enrollment and clinical data Working knowledge in clinical coding systems (ICD-9, ICD-10, CPT-4, DRG, etc.) Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business, Finance or related major required Minimum one to three years of experience in health insurance or Healthcare Consulting experience required Experience in data management and clinical analysis required Demonstrated ability to produce reports and analyses from MS Access databases, MS Excel spreadsheets, etc.required Prior SAS programming experience. Knowledge of Visual Basic, and SQL programming preferable Familiarity with data warehouse required Company Statement:Careers at EmblemHealth: For nine decades, EmblemHealth has been making quality health care accessible and affordable for New Yorkers, and helping to make life better in the communities we serve. Our employees are proud of that legacy and want to make health care better for everyone. Here we inspire success while helping employees build meaningful careers. We offer competitive health and welfare benefits, retirement benefits, and incentive pay plans. Join us for a rewarding experience.EEOC Statement:We are committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of our workforce to create opportunities for our people and our business. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Director, Data Science Engineering
descr: Director, Data Science Engineering AppNexus is looking for an intellectually curious, results-oriented, and energetic Director of Data Science Engineering who is eager to take on the opportunity of having an immediate impact on our products related to predictive analytics, data science and machine learning. Every day we grapple with fascinating software architecture questions on a global platform that operates at massive scale. We pair program, we have impromptu design discussions, and we ask and answer questions of each other constantly. Line by line, we’re writing the best software in the advertising technology industry. In this role, reporting directly to our Chief Platform Architect, you will work very closely with our executives, and lead a small team of Senior Engineers with an array of backgrounds, collaborating to research and design novel algorithmic products. About the job: Apply deep, creative, rigorous thinking to solve broad, platform-wide technical and/or business problems Provide guidance and develop senior members of the Data Science Engineering Team; Educate, mentor and collaborate, both to build out specific projects and to continuously learn and teach new technology and techniques Guide team in researching, designing, simulating, and/or prototyping new product features per business needs Work with Product Management and a cross-functional team using agile methodologies to ensure optimal team performance and delivery Communicate findings and solutions clearly to a variety of audiences, by drafting clear, comprehensive specs for engineers or explaining algorithmic concepts to product managers Own and drive software development life cycle for multiple products in a fast-paced environment Ability to evaluate, recommend and deploy new tools or systems whether they be built in house, open source, or commercial offerings Spend 20% of time coding Engage in hiring and recruiting by working very closely with our internal Talent Acquisition Group About your skills: BA/BS/MS degree and 5+ years of experience (Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred) 5+ years of analytical solution experience with strong system and mathematical skills Passion for building systems and solutions that manifests itself as delivering successful projects Ability to dive deep when needed and strategize across tools, platforms, and create solutions across a diverse stack Excellence at formulating, understanding, and solving complex, non-routine problems Experience working with Big Data, Machine learning, distributed systems using technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Python, Java and Scala Aptitude for diving into learning new theory and new technology, and for standing up or improving organizational processes to enhance communication and productivity within and across teams Provide daily guidance to Optimization Engineering team members in a complex, high-performance platform by working through creative solutions, identifying issues and roadblocks, and reviewing system architecture decisions More about you: You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower others You like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happen You care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystem You believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools.

title: Senior Product Data Analyst
descr: We are looking for a seasoned data analyst to become a key player of our Data Product team. Successful candidates will be responsible for empowering our team with meaningful data, validating new products and features, identifying optimization opportunities, and paving the road for a company that will triple in a short amount of time. The candidate will be working on a myriad of projects and efforts, including many driven by their own insights and findings. There's never a dull moment; repetitive tasks are non-existent. There's an absolutely incredible amount you will learn here, and youll be working with one of the largest user behavior datasets in existence. Data is your passion, you're eager to learn, and you're ready to fully exercise your skill-set. Responsibilities: Working with product teams to validate functionality and advise on data and analytics tracking Setting up real-time alerts Analyzing historical data, defining best practices, and identifying opportunities for optimization Setting up dashboards and visualizations with our BI tool Fulfilling ad-hoc query requests Partnering with business stakeholders to identify strategic business metrics and actionable insights   Capabilities and Qualities: You're a SQL pro and are excited to learn Google BigQuery You can perform advanced data transformations in SQL and Excel You can write your own scripts and CRONs You can handle a large workload and efficiently prioritize You're forward thinking, dynamic, and innovative You're eager to learn Requirements: 4-5 years applicable experience Advanced knowledge and experience with SQL Advanced knowledge of at least one scripting language Marketing background preferred Experience using BI or visualization software BounceX is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. About Us: Founded in 2012, BounceXs People-Based Marketing (PBM) cloud is the first new revenue channel with scale in 10 years. With offices in NYC and London and named the fastest growing software company in America by Inc Magazine in 2016, we currently power thousands of digital properties, expanding across a multitude of industries. For the first time, brands and publishers have a meaningful paid channel outside of Google and Facebook. We are trusted by global enterprises such as Forever21, Avis, JetBlue, CNN, Uniqlo, Comcast and many more. BounceX is built on the belief that the success of a company is rooted in the strength of its team, so weve created a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages employees to love coming to work. World-class benefits like paid family leave, career coaching and donation matching are just a few of the things that make BounceX different. But its the people who truly stand out, each owning their piece of the company with unrivaled dedication, creativity and tenacity. Ryan Urban (CEO) on the Future of Digital Marketing Startups to Watch in 2018 Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Software Companies Deloitte Tech Fast 500 Fortune's Best Workplaces in Tech Crain's Best Places to Work in NYC

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
descr: In case this isn't obvious: you need insurance. The distaste you just felt at the word “insurance” is what drives us to upend the industry. Financial protection might never be super fun, but at least it can be easy. Policygenius is a NYC-based tech startup with a mission to help people get the financial protection they need and have them feel good about it. We are changing a massive industry by making insurance shopping faster, friendlier and more transparent for online consumers. Since our launch in 2014, we’ve achieved rapid growth in a notoriously difficult industry and established ourselves as a pioneer in a now hot sector of FinTech. We're at an exciting inflection point, having raised over $52 million of venture capital, and we're focused on building out our powerhouse team. Think of us as a one-stop-shop for all the financial protection you’ll ever need. The Role… Do you want to be a part of a world class analytics organization whose insights influence the trajectory of a business? Are you passionate about finding insights from data and turning insights into action to shape all parts of a business? In the Business Intelligence Analyst role, you will focus on data analysis and reporting to impact both day-to-day business as well as key strategic initiatives across the enterprise. You will work closely with business stakeholders to deliver data-driven solutions while also working closely with data engineers to better understand our ETL systems and processes. This role reports to the Head of Business Intelligence / Data. You Will… Partner with cross-functional teams to address business questions and diagnose problems; apply both creative and rigorous analyses; and drive insights into actionable business decisions Work with the operations team to drive efficiencies and continuous improvement Work with the marketing team to support a world class growth engine   Work with the engineering team to develop algorithms that continue to drive fintech innovation in the insurance industry   Work with finance to accurately track and analyze the financial health of the company Work across the entire organization to help define, set, and track KPIs and OKRs for success Participate in company strategy development and operational capacity allocations You Have… Demonstrated general problem solving skills using data and statistics The desire to not only tackle a variety of business problems but also provide insight   Expertise in Excel and SQL working with diverse data sets are a must Proficiency in Tableau or similar business intelligence platform, (e.g. Qlikview, Domo, etc.) is strongly desired The ability to pick up new skills and domain knowledge quickly Ability to react to change in a productive and positive manner Strong attention to detail and self-management A bachelor’s degree in mathematics, economics, and/or social sciences is strongly preferred A deep appreciation for the power of a well-placed gif Working at Policygenius… Competitive compensation and company-paid health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance A custom-designed office between Flatiron and Union Square 401k plan, FSA & commuter benefits Flexible PTO Opportunities for paid training, mentorship and coaching from leadership The opportunity to say you were one of the early employees in the company that’s going to shake up a big, old-fashioned industry! FUN, diverse, open-minded coworkers! Dog companionship!! Some fun surprises when you join… (Shhh… It’s a secret!)

title: Software Developer (Python, GIS, Big Data)
descr: Your Role Are you an experienced full stack developer? Are you innovative with broad development skills that you keep current? Are you a committed team player able to work with and support others as they support you? We’re looking for someone like that to help us: -create world-class solutions for geospatial processing and data analysis using agile methods  -design and implement new features in Python, SQL and Big Data technologies -produce high quality technical documentation -collaborate with data scientists, geospatial analysts and other business teams  -collaborate with Infrastructure and CTO teams to introduce new technology as required Your team You’ll be working within Research and Sales IT focused on our Evidence Lab platform. We use agile development methods to deliver the technical platform that underpins the work of the UBS Evidence Lab, the largest, most experienced primary research team in sell-side research. We design, develop, deploy and maintain a range of complex systems to enable the capture and analysis of data using both traditional and Big Data technologies, complementing this stack by evaluating and integrating leading edge commercial software where appropriate. As a developer supporting the UBS Evidence Lab Geospatial Analysis team you will be working alongside seasoned former Silicon Valley software engineers, who are able to provide guidance and mentorship in the areas of data analysis and machine-learning, and building high-performance software. Your experience and skills You have: • at least 5 years strong software development experience, preferably with depth in Python and experience of Java and Linux • understanding of Computer Science fundamentals in OOD, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis. • in depth experience with data modelling and relational databases, such as Oracle (SQL, PL/SQL).  • Preferably knowledge of GIS development • experience with test driven development and continuous integration • a passion for creating software that provides an exceptional customer experience • excellent communication and interpersonal skills • experience or at least a keen interest in common Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark and cloud deployments What we offer Together. That’s how we do things. We offer people around the world a supportive, challenging and diverse working environment. We value your passion and commitment, and reward your performance. Keen to achieve the work-life agility that you desire? We're open to discussing how this could work for you (and us). Take the next step Are you truly collaborative? Succeeding at UBS means respecting, understanding and trusting colleagues and clients. Challenging others and being challenged in return. Being passionate about what you do. Driving yourself forward, always wanting to do things the right way. Does that sound like you? Then you have the right stuff to join us. Apply now. Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: Principal Data Engineer
descr: POSITION SUMMARY Aetna Analytics&Behavior Change (ABC) mandate is to transform health and wellness through data analytics&machine learning products that enable consumer engagement and a best-in-class experience. This team is responsible for building data products, involving real time ingestion frameworks, data pipelines to process large volumes of poly structure data, and model deployment; as well as the envisioning strategic data roadmap and execution of the roadmap. A key part of this team is to build an integrated data platform and supporting products to drive engagement and revolutionize health and wellness. Aetna ABC is looking for a Principal Data Engineer to join our team in Burlington, MA or Wellesley, MA. In this role, you will participate in the development, validation and delivery of algorithms, complex software processes, integration of existing or new subsystems. Develop moderately complex enterprise, web or mobile applications/components. FUNDAMENTAL RESPONSIBILITIES : Principal Data Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing and deployment of data solutions leveraging Hadoop&related technology stack (PySpark, Java, etc) Ability to architect end to end solution and lead the implementation of the solution; involves socialization and engagement with Aetna's technology leaders (architects&business teams) Need deep expertise in software engineering concepts, latest technology acumen and ability to design secure, effective&scalable solutions. Explores, examines and interprets large volumes of data in various forms Proven ability to work across multiple facets across multiple projects, ability to prioritize objectives, communicate clearly to all the stakeholders Highly motivated with strong business analytic sense and the ability to create innovative solutions. Collaborate with stakeholders and document projects artifacts including business objectives, data needs, function specifications, test requirements and SLAs Above all, eager and willing to explore new and advanced technologies, pilot use cases and roll it out for production solutions BACKGROUND/ EXPERIENCE : 7+ years software development/ programming experience in core Java (Client&Server Applications), / Cloud Applications / Building Data products Fluent with functional, imperative and object-oriented languages and methodologies. Knowledge of design patterns is desirable. Experience with variety of database technologies, primarily BIG DATA technologies (Hadoop), SQL (MySQL, Postgres) and NoSQL(MongoDB/HBase/ReDis). Strong knowledge of programming languages/tools including: Java, Python, Spark, SQL, Hive, JavaScript, Shell Scripts Experience implementing and consuming large-scale web services (RESTful APIs) Experience with Angular JS/HTML5/Node JS are big plus Experience coding, testing and documenting middleware/ server side modules. Familiarity with various operating systems (Linux/ Windows) Knowledge and experience of DevOps is desirable. Knowledge of design patterns is desirable. Exposure to container technologies (Docker or similar) and orchestration is a big plus. Experience working in an agile environment, and demonstrates good written&verbal communication and presentation skills with technical&business teams. Experience with mission critical, 24x7 systems EDUCATION The highest level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Master's degree. Aetna is about more than just doing a job. This is our opportunity to re-shape healthcare for America and across the globe. We are developing solutions to improve the quality and affordability of healthcare. What we do will benefit generations to come. We care about each other, our customers and our communities. We are inspired to make a difference, and we are committed to integrity and excellence. Together we will empower people to live healthier lives. Aetna is an equal opportunity&affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of personal characteristics or status. We take affirmative action to recruit, select and develop women, people of color, veterans and individuals with disabilities. We are a company built on excellence. We have a culture that values growth, achievement and diversity and a workplace where your voice can be heard. Benefit eligibility may vary by position. Click here to review the benefits associated with this position. Aetna takes our candidate's data privacy seriously. At no time will any Aetna recruiter or employee request any financial or personal information (Social Security Number, Credit card information for direct deposit, etc.) from you via e-mail. Any requests for information will be discussed prior and will be conducted through a secure website provided by the recruiter. Should you be asked for such information, please notify us immediately. Employment Type Regular Career Band Description Professional

title: Market Data Engineer
descr: Market Data Engineer The Market Data Engineering role consists of designing and supporting market data ticker plants globally. Competency in Reuters TREP, Bloomberg, and direct feed infrastructures are required. Software development experience in C, C++ or Java is a BIG plus. This role has design, engineering, and support responsibilities. The primary focus will be for our US-based locations but will, on occasion, be asked to support international locations. The candidate must be comfortable speaking directly with Portfolio managers, traders and other key personnel within the firm. This Engineer is responsible for ensuring that all of the firm's market data ticker plants are functioning, answering users' technology questions, and addressing problems as quickly as possible. The function of the role will increase over time so some experience and the desire and ability to work in this space is a prerequisite. Primary Responsibility: Ensure the market direct ticker plants (Reuters, Bloomberg, direct feeds) are operational, reliable, and are maintained to specifications as designed. Provide basic API assistance to traders and internal technologists. Assist in testing and evaluating of different market data solutions as directed by management. Monitor the system for market data utilization and participate in capacity planning exercises. Skills Required: Experience with maintaining Reuters, Bloomberg, and direct feed market data ticker plants. Software development experience in C, C++ or Java is a BIG plus. Familiarity basic Reuters, Bloomberg, Exchange symbologies and content. Working knowledge of network protocols. Ability to interface and maintain excellent working relationships with traders, other IT staff and vendors. Ability to maintain composure under pressure and to communicate effectively with business and IT management regarding outages and problems.

title: Marketing Operations & Analytics Manager
descr: Develop lead generation/campaign objectives, goals, and metrics, and define best practices, standards and processes to drive successful customer acquisition and funnel conversion Own end-to-end lead funnel, including implementation, lead flow/distribution, lead follow up processes, documentation, adoption of best practices, training, and measurement Take ownership of data integrity and data management initiatives, including segmentation and analysis, process workflows, data uploads and data augmentation Create reporting and analytics on demand generation performance; including dashboards, campaign metrics, and attribution across marketing campaigns/channels (webinars, email marketing, tradeshows & hosted events, digital advertising, social media, website, content, landing pages, etc Monitor the performance of the demand generation funnel, plan versus actual and against industry benchmarks Manage lead scoring model and all related processes in marketing automation and CRM tools Optimize our email marketing to drive higher CTRs – using A/B testing, testing email templates, personalization, and segmentation. Plan and manage lead nurturing email marketing programs to accelerate prospect movement through the demand generation funnel Actively strengthen the relationship between Sales and Marketing by being the main point of contact for feedback on processes and leads. Use automation to solve business problems, collaborate with key stakeholders to identify gaps in current processes/systems, and optimize workflows to increase marketing and sales productivity You’ll be measured based on improved conversion rates, and cost per qualified leads, and your ability to assist in increased process adoption Role Requirements: 5+ years experience in marketing operations and analytics, preferably in a B2B enterprise software company Must be a proficient user of Salesforce and Marketing Automation (Company or Eloqua) Google Analytics experience preferred for reporting on 360-degree marketing activities Experience creating marketing reports/dashboards, utilizing strong analytical skills and attention to detail, in order to guide strategy and influence stakeholders Must be analytical and able to derive meaning from data and present results in an actionable format Ability to take ownership of complex projects, from ideation through implementation and beyond Willing to work and execute on a tactical as well as strategic level Problem solver with a successful history of using a proactive, process-driven approach to managing risks and issues Detail-oriented and accurate; enjoys problem-solving and being challenged

title: Quantitative Analyst
descr: Citigroup Global Markets Inc. seeks a Quantitative Analyst for its New York, New York location. Duties: Develop, test and maintain mathematical models for market forecasting of mortgages, interest rate modeling, calculation of prepayments, defaults and losses, and analysis of Basel capital requirements, for residential and commercial mortgages and other asset-backed securities. Use statistical, mathematical, and machine learning approaches to model mortgage borrower prepayment and default behavior. Perform advanced computerized quantitative analysis, involving the use of highly sophisticated quantitative methodologies including linear and non-linear optimization, Monte Carlo simulations, statistics, and numerical methods, to aid in the development and maintenance of the Residential Mortgage Backed Security (“RMBS”) default, prepayment, loss severity, and roll rate transition models. Analyze large datasets to identify market trends. Employ programming languages and technologies, including C, C , R, SQL, Python, Perl, and VBA, to ensure the accurate implementation of the models on various analytical platforms. Communicate with internal and external model users to explain the workings of the models. Requirements: Requires a Master’s degree in Computational Finance, Mathematics or related quantitative field and 3 years of experience as a Quantitative Analyst/Associate, Model Development Analyst, or related position performing quantitative modeling in the financial services industry. Must have 3 years of work experience with: Mathematical and statistical analysis of datasets; Quantitative modeling for securitized products, including mortgage and asset backed securities; Developing and implementing models using C programming, VBA, R, SQL, Python and Perl; Modelling Basel or CCAR regulatory capital requirements; Using machine learning to develop models. Qualified applicants submit resumes referencing job code EJ/QA/RH to Citigroup Recruiting Department, 3800 Citigroup Center Drive, Tampa, FL 33610. Citigroup is an EOE Employer. This position is eligible for incentives pursuant to Citigroup’s Employee Referral Program. Direct applicants only.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
orgname: Paul Weiss Rifkind Wharton & Garrison LLP
descr: Under the supervision of the RBI Director and BI Manager, the analyst will conduct specialized research and analysis of companies, industries, markets and competitors, using a comprehensive variety of print and online resources. The analyst will develop and communicate insightful and actionable business intelligence and provide meaningful recommendations to support business growth and profitability. The qualified individual will also have the ability to work well in a collaborative environment. Responsibilities Research, analyze and prepare reports on a wide variety of company, business, industry, markets and/or competitor data to support the firm’s business development and strategic initiatives.   Provide research assistance to lawyers to support practice or client-related projects as assigned. Assist in efforts to market the BI group’s service to firm personnel. Monitor news developments affecting the legal and other industries, key clients and other topics as assigned. Keep metrics on work completed for monthly and annual reports. Perform special projects and other duties as assigned. Required Skills Requires advanced degree or some equivalent of education and experience with focus on market analysis and business intelligence/financial services and a minimum of three years of business/competitive intelligence research experience, with some knowledge of legal research a plus.   Highly tuned research and analysis skills, with ability to analyze data and draw conclusions and to provide actionable intelligence.   Exceptional written, oral communication and customer service skills. Strong knowledge of competitive intelligence principles as they relate to law firms or corporate entities. Demonstrated ability to synthesize and distill information from diverse sources and deliver objective, meaningful insights in concise, compelling ways.   Solid ability working with financial/business and industry specific databases and Microsoft products, particularly Word and Excel. Ability to work well with staff at all levels of the firm, as well as handle an array of projects, many under tight deadlines. Self-starter with a strong ability to effectively manage multiple projects concurrently and a flexibility and willingness to work extended hours as required. Strong sense of urgency and professional dedication. Disclaimer Statement The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of the work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Required Experience Job Location New York, US-NY

title: Data Analyst, ORPA
descr: Company Overview At Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK), we’re not only changing the way we treat cancer, but also the way the world thinks about it. By working together and pushing forward with innovation and discovery, we’re driving excellence and improving outcomes. For the 28th year, MSK has been named a top hospital for cancer by U.S. News & World Report. We are proud to be on Becker’s Healthcare list as one of the 150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare in 2018, as well as one of Glassdoor’s Employees’ Choice Best Place to Work for 2018. We’re treating cancer, one patient at a time.  Join us and make a difference every day. Job Description The  Data Analyst  is an integral member of the Office of Research and Project Administration (ORPA) team that is responsible for managing, analyzing and maintaining the integrity, completeness and accuracy of MSK's sponsored projects proposal and award data. You will develop and maintain production reports, and oversee grants management information systems and processes, in collaboration with Research and Technology Management's Information Technology Department. You will:   Analyze MSK’s grant data, ensure data integrity, and oversee data quality assurance. Create high level ad hoc reports required or requested by ORPA and the MSK research community, including MSK's senior leadership, Vice Presidents and Board of Directors.   Use SQL, Tableau, Excel, Cognos Reports, Cognos Query Studio, and/or internal/external systems, websites and databases to design or produce reports for RTM or MSK research community use that serve to further educate and inform these constituencies about MSK research activity and productivity and improve workflow.   Serve as a liaison with RTM IT to determine optimal enhancements for current systems and workflow, and to develop tools to improve systems. Design and lead test plans for system enhancements, and oversee rigorous testing of new software functions.   Responsible for creating and implementing training modules and presentations for all aspects of grants management information systems and processes for internal users and the MSK research community.   Ensure ORPA databases contain correct, compliant and necessary information; monitor data in the institutional grants management system for accuracy and completeness.   Utilize proposal, award and systems knowledge to analyze data and regularly scheduled reports and work flow, ensuring report integrity, quality control and completion.   Provide technical assistance with respect to data input, reports, reporting tools and grants management systems to MSK’s research community. You need:   Bachelor’s Degree with 2-4 years of experience with data analysis.   Familiarity with relational databases, SQL, Tableau, and Excel. Preferred:   Prior experience working with sponsored research proposal and award #LI-SB1 Closing MSK is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran status or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.

title: Internal Audit Director, Big Data Architecture and Analytics
descr: JobDescription : The   Role:  Internal Audit Director, Big Data Architecture and Analytics The   Location:  55 Water St, NY, NY 10041 The   Team:  This role is for an experienced audit analytics professional to join the Internal Audit Team. The Audit Director - Data Analytics is responsible for owning the Data Analytics team. The role will develop repeatable data analytics processes to provide real-time audit assurance and improving audit efficiencies and will have one direct report, while demonstrating a pool of resources The   Impact:  This position will be driving analytics and technology strategy for Internal Audit and will collaborate with the Vice President, Global Auditor who owns the internal Audit function. This role will also be responsible for improving the Internal Audit value proposition to the leadership team by utilizing various emerging Technologies such as A.I. and Big Data to drive business results. Responsibilities: Engage and partner with audit team members, and audit management, to help deliver new Data Analytics Audit strategy Develop Strategies to champion data analytics extensively in planning and scoping of Audits, as well as in reporting, follow-up and annual Audit planning Propose and implement techniques, including analysis of unstructured data and use of technology tools Engage with key partners in the company on Data Analytics/Business Intelligence Build the use of predictive analytics and robotics process automation Develop talent/specialist for Data Analytics Develop training and usage of Data Analytics capabilities within Internal Audit staff Build and Maintain Audit Data Analytics architecture, tools and techniques Develop core skills for power users Identify and develop innovative and re-usable analytics solutions/applications which can be used by the stakeholders to drive auditor ‘self-service’ Keep abreast of new industry tools and emerging technologies which may offer improved functionality or a more efficient and effective ability to deliver audit analytics solutions Basic   Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree with at least 8+ years of experience of Big Data experience CISA, or any meaningful Big Data certification preferred Experience with software such as Tableau, Python or SQL Understanding of public cloud and infrastructure Knowledge of Automation technologies like (Blue Prism or Hadoop) Preferred   Qualifications: Data Scientist Profile and Experience Big 4 Consulting Experience About S&P Global At S&P Global, we don’t give you intelligence—we give you essential intelligence. The essential intelligence you need to make decisions with conviction. We’re the world’s foremost provider of ratings, benchmarks and analytics in the global capital and commodity markets. Our divisions include: S&P Global Ratings, which provides credit ratings, research and insights essential to driving growth and transparency. S&P Global Market Intelligence, which provides insights into companies, markets and data so that business and financial decisions can be made with conviction. S&P Dow Jones Indices, the world’s largest resource for iconic and innovative indices, which helps investors pinpoint global opportunities. S&P Global Platts, which equips customers to identify and seize opportunities in energy and commodities, stimulating business growth and market transparency. To all recruitment agencies: S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related to such resumes.
